After graduating in systems biology at the Paris-Saclay University, **Remy Nicolle** obtained his Ph.D. at the Institut Curie studying the transcriptional dysregulations driving bladder cancer. He joined the CIT in 2015 to focus on the genomics of pancreatic cancer.
